Former Florida Gov: Charlie Crist's claim that six people in Florida die every day as a result of not expanding Medicaid.
Researchers conducted a study on states: including Florida, and estimated a range of deaths that would occur as a result.
The high: end estimate from the study concluded that the number of deaths in Florida would range from 1,158 to 2,221.
Crist arrived at his six: deaths-a-day figure by using the high-end range from the study, dividing the total number of deaths by 365 days a year.
